name: 1.1 - Ensure that the latest revision of the relevant drawing is being used.
Verifying Document - Current Plan and Longsection revisions being used to install
Verifying Document - Correspondence of Datum to use
1.3 - Confirm existing and proposed drainage locations
Verifying Document - Asbuilt of Existing Manholes
1.4 - All wastewater pipes and manholes shall be placed in accordance with Engineer's model and locations given in design drawings.
Verifying Document - Drainage Models provided by Engineer
1.5 - Wastewater Connection Authorisation approval from Veolia for Tie-ins into existing
Verifying Document - Signed Wastewater Connection Authorsiation form from Veolia
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.

2.1 - Wastewater trench should be excavated to design levels given in drawings. Tolerances given are -0mm, +50mm for line and -50mm, +0mm for level. Trench to be benched or battered when depth exceed 1.2m. Trench width to be dependant on pipe diameter and trench depth. Use trench shield if battered cannot be achieve.
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - NZS 4404:2010, AS/NZS 2566.2 WorkSafe NZ – Good Practice Guidelines: Excavation Safety
2.2 - IF rock is encountered levels and photos are to be taken. Geotech must inspect rock prior to any break out. Levels and photos must be taken post-breakout.
2.3 - Breakout to commence only once Client have issued a site instruction
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
3.1 - The position tolerance for pipe laying at any point along the length of the installation shall be within ±30 mm from the specified design.
3.2 - Ensure grade with digital spirit level matches design grade along pipe alignment
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Auckland Council Requirement
3.3 - Asbuilt of pipe invert levels prior to Auckland Council Inspection
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Auckland Council Requirement
3.4 - Allow Auckland Council opportunity to inspect pipeline prior to backfill
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Auckland Council Requirement
3.6 - Allow Veolia opportunity to inspect Tie-in prior to backfill
3.7 - Backfill line in 200mm layers and conduct Clegg Hammer Impact Tests for Hardfill achieving CIV 25
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Watercare C2.21 row 12
Verifying Document - Clegg Hammer Results Sheet
3.8 - Backfill line in 300mm layers and conduct Shearvanes for clay fill achieving average value not less than 150KPA
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Engenium Excavation and Hardfil Spec. Item 2.4
Verifying Document - Shear Vane Results Sheet
3.9 - Pipework shall be CCTV inspected for defects, in particular pipe joints and to identify ponding areas for correction in gravity systems
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Watercare General Civil Construction Standard C3.1j
Verifying Document - CCTV Footage and Reports
3.10 - Watertightness Testing in presence of Auckland Council and Engineer
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Watercare General Civil Construction Standard C10.5.1
Verifying Document - Council inspection report and Engineer Correspondence
WW 4.0 - Handover to client with PS3
4.2 - As built all pipe invert levels in manholes and CP and lid levels

2.1 - Manhole shall be placed on firm natural ground
2.2 - IF rock is encountered levels and photos are to be taken. Geotech must inspect rock prior to any break out. Levels and photos must be taken post-breakout.

3.1 - Manhole Base to be laid on minimum 100mm bed of Gap20
3.2 - Hydrophilic Seal Starters to be used to connnect into manhole
3.3 - Haunching to be done on all lines entering manhole
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Auckland Council Requirement
Verifying Document - Photos of Haunching outside manhole
3.4 - Asbuilt of Manhole invert levels prior to Auckland Council Inspection
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Auckland Council Requirement

Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Watercare C2.21  row 12
Verifying Document - Clegg Hammer Results Sheet
3.8 - Backfill Manhole in 300mm layers and conduct Shearvanes for clay fill achieving average value not less than 150KPA
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Engenium Excavation and Hardfil Spec. Item 2.4
Verifying Document - Shear Vane Results Sheet
3.9 - Benching to be done with Half Round Channel pipe earthenware
Spec Reference/Special Conditions - Watercare WW5, Watercare WW9
3.10 - Steps to be installed, ensure that lid opening is orientated on sthe location of steps.
3.11 - Ensure full entry depth of throat is not greater than 450mm and that the finishing around it is complete.

3.12 - Manhole covers in the road shall be constructed so that the cover hinge is facing the oncoming traffic, for all other covers the orientation should be so that the cover hinge is at 90 degrees from the ladder, either side.
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
